msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 140 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 23; Qurʾānic Text: Q 35:43-end; 10 lines per page; Dimensions: 215 x 140mm; Script style: kūfīز

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 25f: "75 E. H. 23. Kur’anın son s̠ülüsü. Hafifçe penbe boyalı parşömen. 140mm boy ve 215mm eninde cönk şeklinde 140 yaprak. Sahifede altınla yazılmış kufi yazı ile 185mm uzunl.[uğunda] 10 satır. Sonundaki ketebede hicretin 20. senesi ramazanın yazısında Ḥasan b. Alī b. ebī Ṭālib eliyle yazıldığı muharrer ise de yazının IV. asra ait olması muhtemeldir. Sure başları ve duraklar müzehheptir. Miklepli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu mushaf Fāṭir (35) suresinin 43. ayetinin sonundaki الله تحويلا (لسنت)ibaresinden başlar Ḳur’an’ın sonuna kadar devam eder."

This can be translated as follows: "75 E. H. 23. The last one-third of the Quran. A lightly pink-tinted parchment. 140 junk shaped leaves of 140 mm height and 215 mm width. The text area written with Kufic script in gold ink [contains] 10 lines measuring 185 mm. Although, in the kataba record at the and of the [MS], it is inscribed that it was written by Ḥasan bin ʿAlī ibn abī Ṭālib in the 20th year of the Hijra during the month of Ramadan, the script is likely from the 4th century. Gilded sūra beginnings and verse separators. Cherry-brown-colored leather binding with flap (miklep). This codex begins the wording الله تحويلا (لسنت)at the end of the Q 35:43 (Sūra al-Fāṭir) and continues until the end of the Qurʾān.”
